frontmatter.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering Co-Located with KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2024
frontmatter.location: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2024 in Paris, France
frontmatter.venue_address: 16 Rue du Colonel Pierre Avia, Paris, France
frontmatter.price: In-Person and Virtual Attendance are FREE
frontmatter.lead_text: This OpenShift Commons Gathering is on March 19, 2024 in Central European Time (CET)
frontmatter.info_text: This OpenShift Commons Gathering will be held live in Paris, France and broadcast live to regional watch parties around the globe. As always, our focus is on creating a space for peer-to-peer interactions and we'll be going hybrid, so if you are unable to attend in person, join us online. This Gathering will focus on Emerging Technology and Case Studies from and by End Users with production deployments of OpenShift sharing their use cases, insights into their workloads and  lessons learned along the way. Topics covered during this Gathering include hybrid cloud infrastructure, cloud-native development, and new Emerging technology initiatives on the Edge.
frontmatter.event_footer_text: This OpenShift Commons Gathering will be held on Central European Time (CET). Please note: In-person attendees are encouraged to also register for KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2024, however, it is not mandatory. Reception is Open to all registered attendees and starts at 5:00 p.m.

schedule.session_name: Welcome to the Commons: Collaboration in Action
OpenShift: The Road Ahead and Release Update
Deploying Text Generation Inference on Kubernetes
Case Study: OpenShift AI at Airbus
IOWN: An Efficient Infrastructure for AI Analysis
Industrial Digital Transformation at Airbus Helicopters
From Mainframe to OpenShift - A Three Year Journey
The Evolution of Authentication: A Keycloak Success Story
The Future of Software Deployment: WebAssembly's Edge Over Containers on OpenShift
Evolving OpenShift: A Journey towards Modernization through Automation
Lightning Talk: Speeding up SELinux in OpenShift
AMA with Red Hat Engineers, Product Managers, Project Leads and Guest Speakers
Data and AI Community Meetup and Breakout
